channel.title: Cable modems
channel.description:
well, my mom says that i 'have' to ask someone, so can someone just verify what I already know? I own a cable modem. we hooked the cable modem to a router, and a wireless card to the router. the wireless card would connect to the router, but not to the internet. I was wondering, scince we have a cable splitter to allow someone to watch cable and be on the internet, can i hook up another modem? my mom is worried charter wont allow 2 computers to access the internet at the same time if they both have seperate routers. should I be worried about this, or is my mom just not understanding what I tell her? any help is greatly apprecciated.
~Izkavan

item.title: Cable modems
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

If you have seprate Routers they do charge extra Connor.

Read full topic
